node.title: Over 300 dogs found dead in Ukrainian shelter after weeks without food or water
node.description: Disturbing footage appeared showed dead dogs on the floor of the shelter.

node.title: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam to not seek second term
node.description: Hong Kong's leader Carrie Lam has announced she will not seek a second term in office after a controversial tenure that has seen many of the territory's civil freedoms eroded.

node.title: Biden's granddaughter Naomi to have wedding reception at White House
node.description: President Biden and first lady Jill Biden will host the wedding of Naomi Biden and Peter Neal on November 19.

node.title: Police who killed were given evidence in advance
node.description: When police shoot and kill, they're investigated by fellow officers. Guyon Espiner reveals that shooters have been shown evidence in advance of being interviewed.

node.title: Handyman pleads guilty to killing 67-year-old woman who feared him
node.description: Authorities said Elizabeth Wiesenfeld had told her family she was afraid of Douglas Berry, who had been doing work on her house and kept showing up even though she had stopped hiring him.

node.title: Police continue search for missing 13-year-old
node.description: Police are appealing to the public for sightings of missing teenager Aria Bridger, who was last seen in Auckland on 28 March.

node.title: Tennis number one admits she got emotional about Barty's retirement
node.description: World number one Iga Swiatek said she cried for 40 minutes after learning of three-times Grand Slam champion Ash Barty's shock retirement from tennis last month.

node.title: Suspect arrested in Sacramento mass shooting that killed 6, wounded 12
node.description: The 26-year-old has been charged with assault and illegal firearm possession.

node.title: MBAs in management lead to lower employee pay, study finds
node.description: Researchers point to the popularity of professional management degrees as one reason worker pay has declined.

node.title: Tennis number admits she got very emotional about Barty's retirement
node.description: World number one Iga Swiatek said she cried for 40 minutes after learning of three-times Grand Slam champion Ash Barty's shock retirement from tennis last month.

node.title: Senate strikes $10 billion deal on COVID-19 relief
node.description: It's significantly less than the funding the White House requested.

node.title: 99% of the world is breathing poor-quality air, WHO says
node.description: That air is often rife with particles that can penetrate deep into the lungs, enter the veins and arteries, and cause disease.

node.title: Medicare enrollees can now get free COVID-19 tests at drug stores
node.description: Over 59 million people with Medicare's "Part B" outpatient coverage will be able to get up to eight free at-home tests per month.

node.title: The roots go deep at Wānaka vineyard
node.description: Country Life - Each vine has an individual voice at Rippon, according to winemaker and viticulturalist Nick Mills, whose parents established the vineyard now in the hands of the next generation. Audio

node.title: Life in transition: What it's like waiting for a state house
node.description: There are currently 5090 families living in transitional housing as they wait for a permanent spot to come up. Local Democracy Reporting's Justin Latif spoke to one of them.

node.title: Coastal Southland sees driest summer on record
node.description: It is coastal Southland's driest summer on record and there is no real relief forecast as the drought pushes into the north of the region.

node.title: Grammys: Rodrigo wins new artist, Zelensky appeals for help
node.description: Olivia Rodrigo has been crowned best new artist at a Grammy awards ceremony featuring a surprise appeal for support from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

node.title: Meet the East Coast woman working round the clock with flood relief
node.description: When Lillian Te Hau-Ward went for a drive to inspect the damage of her small East Coast community after recent flooding, she cried and said she did not want to go back.

node.title: More states return millions, as rent assistance battle heats up
node.description: "All these nonprofits, when people come to them asking for help, the bucket will be empty," a United Way president said.

node.title: Here are the women who will appear on quarters in 2023
node.description: Among the honorees are a former first lady, pilot, ballerina, composer and journalist.

node.title: New study links heavy drinking during pandemic to increased obesity rates
node.description: People also reported exercising more and smoking less — but not enough to offset other unhealthy habits.

node.title: Woman convicted in baby's 1981 death released after 3 months in prison
node.description: The case of the infant's death remained unsolved until 2019 when advances in DNA technology led investigators to Theresa Bentaas

node.title: Disney hand sanitizers recalled; benzene, methanol detected
node.description: Baby Yoda and Mickey Mouse-themed products were sold nationwide at three retail locations, according to FDA notice.

node.title: High gas prices make remote work even more attractive
node.description: Surging fuel costs — and more costly commutes — could complicate employers' efforts to call workers back to their desks.

node.title: Russia claims massacre "fake" as evidence of Ukraine atrocities mounts
node.description: Moscow calls the latest reports of mass civilian killings near Kyiv a faked "provocation," as the U.S. says it's helping gather evidence of war crimes by Putin's troops.

node.title: U.N.: World hurtling to climate danger zone, leaders "lying" about efforts
node.description: "It is a file of shame, cataloguing the empty pledges that put us firmly on track towards an unlivable world," U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said.

node.title: Ex-U.S. Marine Trevor Reed ends hunger strike in Russian prison
node.description: Contrary to the prison service's claims, however, a representative for the jailed American says he's "never received any real medical care."

node.title: Deadly road rage shootings hit record high in 2021, data suggests
node.description: In terms of both the total number of road rage shootings, and their deadliness, it was the worst year on record.

node.title: CBS Minnesota uncovers 1970 interview with Prince – at age 11
node.description: Before he was a music superstar, Prince was just a boy at Lincoln Junior High School, being asked about the Minneapolis Junior High teachers strike.

node.title: Biden says Putin should face war crimes trial for alleged atrocities in Ukraine
node.description: "What's happening in Bucha is outrageous and everyone sees it," the president said.
